column1: Jepara (Javanese: ꦗꦼꦥꦫ) is a regency in the northeast of the Indonesian province of Central Java. Its capital is Jepara.
People believed to have come from South Yunnan region migrated into the northern tip of Java during a time when Jepara was still separated by the Juwana Strait.

column2: Jepara was an important port; in early 1513
column4: Yunnus (Pati Unus) led an attack against Portuguese Malacca. His force is said to have been made up of one hundred ships and 5000 men from Jepara and Palembang but was defeated. Between 1518 and 1521 he apparently ruled over Demak. The rule of Ratu ('Queen') Kalinyamat in the latter 16th century was
column6: Jepara's most influential. Jepara again attacked Malacca in 1551 this time with Johor but was defeated
column7: and in 1574 besieged Malacca for three months.It was the site of an English Fort in the 17th century. It is the birthplace of Indonesian national heroine Kartini.

column1: Jepara Regency is located in the northeastern coastal region of Central Java
column2: bordering Java Sea in the north and west
column3: Kudus Regency and Pati Regency in the east
column4: and Demak Regency in the south. The eastern border is primarily a mountainous region
column5: with the most notable peak being Mount Muria. The regency also include the Karimun Java archipelago
column7: located in Java Sea approximately 80 kilometers northwest from Jepara Regency.

column1: Jepara Regency is divided into 16 subdistricts:
The population is almost entirely Javanese and over 95% Muslim. As a pesisir ('coastal') area many traders from around the world landed in Jepara centuries ago. As a result
column2: some of Jepara's resident have at part European
column5: Malay or Bugis ancestry.The town is renowned its furniture industry. The production of teak furniture
column8: working in a large number of mainly small workshops. The trade has brought considerable prosperity to Jepara
column9: well above the average for Central Java.

column1: Tourism in Jepara is an important component of the economy of Jepara and a significant source of tax revenue. Jepara is a town which known for their culinary
column4: and rich cultural heritage. There are many possibilities and opportunities lies for the city to prosper and benefits more
column5: but yet until now the government has not yet fully utilized them. Jepara although only a small town but has many tourist attractions
column9: tour the islands. Foreign tourists often visit Tirto Samodra Beach (Bandengan Beach)
